title: 105_s1505
content: The Act titled "Museum and Library Services Technical and Conforming Amendments of 1997" allows for the appointment of employees. Section 206 of the Museum and Library Services Act is amended to allow the Director to appoint and compensate technical and professional employees without following certain provisions of the United States Code. The Director of the Institute can appoint and compensate technical and professional employees without exceeding a certain percentage of full-time regular employees. The basic compensation rate for these employees cannot exceed the rate for level GS-15 of the General Schedule. SEC. 3. SPECIAL LIBRARIES. Amends the Museum and Library Services Act to include special libraries. SEC. 4. RESERVATIONS. Adjusts percentages in the Museum and Library Services Act. SEC. 5. MAINTENANCE OF EFFORT. Modifies the reduction in the allotment for any fiscal year. SEC. 6. SERVICE TO INDIAN TRIBES. The formula for determining State expenditures is based on a comparison with previous fiscal years. SEC. 6. SERVICE TO INDIAN TRIBES. Amends the Museum and Library Services Act to provide services to Indian tribes and organizations serving Native Hawaiians. Section 262 of the Museum and Library Services Act is amended to include grants, contracts, and cooperative agreements in the program. Section 262 of the Museum and Library Services Act is amended to include grants, contracts, and cooperative agreements in the program. The amendment involves adding "cooperative agreements" after "contracts" and expanding the scope to include grants, contracts, and cooperative agreements. Section 262(a)(3) of the Museum and Library Services Act is amended to change "preservation of digitization" to "preserving or digitization."
